place.name: BAUMBER
place.gazetteerText: BAUMBER, or Bamburgh, a parish in Horncastle district Lincoln; on the Wolds, 4 miles NW by N of Horncastle r. station. It has a post office, of the name. of Banmber, under Horncastle. Acres, 3,200. Real property, £4,052. Pop., 393. Houses, 85. Sturton Hall is the seat of the Liveseys. The living is a vicarage, annexed to Sturton-Magna. The church is good; and there is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
